title: Compiler error fails to show unsatisfied bounds on trait implementation

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
```rust
use pyo3::prelude::*;
use std::collections::HashMap;

fn foo(thing: &PyAny) {
    let arg0: HashMap<Py<PyAny>, u32> = FromPyObject::extract(thing).unwrap();
}

```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `HashMap<pyo3::Py<pyo3::PyAny>, u32>: pyo3::FromPyObject<'_>` is not satisfied
 --> src\lib.rs:5:41
  |
5 |     let arg0: HashMap<Py<PyAny>, u32> = FromPyObject::extract(thing).unwrap();
  |                                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `pyo3::FromPyObject<'_>` is
 not implemented for `HashMap<pyo3::Py<pyo3::PyAny>, u32>`
  |
  = help: the trait `pyo3::FromPyObject<'source>` is implemented for `HashMap<K, V, S>`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
```
In fact, this error is caused by `Py<PyAny>` not implementing `Hash` (and `Eq`). But this is not shown in the error message!

Somehow the unsatisfied bounds on the `FromPyObject` trait are lost. For reference, this is its [definition](https://github.com/PyO3/pyo3/blob/main/src/types/dict.rs#L342-L356):
```rust
impl<'source, K, V, S> FromPyObject<'source> for HashMap<K, V, S>
where
    K: FromPyObject<'source> + cmp::Eq + hash::Hash,
    V: FromPyObject<'source>,
    S: hash::BuildHasher + Default,
{
    fn extract(ob: &'source PyAny) -> Result<Self, PyErr> {
        // ...
    }
}
```

When trying to create a minimal example (by just shimming the trait in an empty crate), the lacking bounds are correctly shown. Unfortunately I can't figure out how to reproduce the error above.
```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `Py<PyAny>: Eq` is not satisfied
 --> src\main.rs:9:41
  |
9 |     let arg0: HashMap<Py<PyAny>, u32> = FromPyObject::extract(unwrapped).unwrap();
  |                                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `Eq` is not implemented for `Py<PyAny>`
  |
  = help: the trait `FromPyObject<'source>` is implemented for `HashMap<K, V, S>`
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `FromPyObject<'_>` for `HashMap<Py<PyAny>, u32>`

error[E0277]: the trait bound `Py<PyAny>: Hash` is not satisfied
 --> src\main.rs:9:41
  |
9 |     let arg0: HashMap<Py<PyAny>, u32> = FromPyObject::extract(unwrapped).unwrap();
  |                                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `Hash` is not implemented for `Py<PyAny>`
  |
  = help: the trait `FromPyObject<'source>` is implemented for `HashMap<K, V, S>`
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `FromPyObject<'_>` for `HashMap<Py<PyAny>, u32>`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
```
